abstract: Harry Shearer, who provides the voices of dozens of "Simpsons" characters including Montgomery Burns, Ned Flanders and Kent Brockman, said he would accept a pay cut of 70 percent or more if Fox were willing to let him share in the profits from the show.

lead_paragraph: As a star of "The Simpsons," Harry Shearer provides the voices of dozens of characters on that Fox animated comedy, from the nefarious plutocrat Montgomery Burns to Homer's gentle next-door neighbor, Ned Flanders. And on Friday Mr. Shearer became the first performer on that long-running series to give voice to the current demands of its acting ensemble, which is locked in a tense negotiation with the 20th Century Fox Television studio while the fate of "The Simpsons" hangs in the balance.

headline.main: 'Simpsons' Voice Actor Speaks Out About Negotiations With Fox
